description:
A CheckBox represents a button with two states, selected and unselected.
This component is wrapped from `@material-ui/core/Checkbox`.
If the label prop is specified, the component renders `@material-ui/core/FormControlLabel`.
If not, it renders a `@material-ui/core/Checkbox`.
Also, it renders an error text with a label if the errorText prop is specified.

checkedIcon.description: Icon to display when the component is checked.

color.description:
Color of the component.
It supports the theme colors that make sense for this component.

disableRipple.description: If `true`, the ripple effect is disabled.

errorTextVisible.description: If `true` and the component has a label and an errorText, the errorText is visible.

icon.description: Icon to display when the component is unchecked.

label.description: If exists, checkbox renders with a `<Label>` component.

componentSize.description:
Defines the size of the component. The ComponentSize constant exported from enums.
@ignore

context.description: Defines application requirements such as localization, theme, platform.

disabled.description: If true, all of the component functionality will be disabled.

id.description: All components should be have id prop.

snapKey.description:
The snapKey property is used to manage snapshots of the child components.
@ignore

snapshot.description:
In our SPA, we want to keep the state of each component when a page will unmount.
And the same page will mount again, the component mounts with snapshot prop and
it should get the previous state.
@ignore

style.description: All components should be have style prop.

valueConstraint.description: The valueConstraint is used to some validation on components like limit, required etc.

visible.description: In ComponentComposer, we change the visibility of the component with this prop.
